description.value:
Through experimentation, practice, and maybe some help from a teacher, you have learned new forms of battle. Fighting Stances are methods of combat that grant the user pros and cons, but only while in use. Pick 2 Fighting Stances from the “Stance List” later in this section.

Usage: Unless stated otherwise, you can change your Fighting Stance as a minor action or at the end of an attack action, so long as you are not @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.RK3DF56CKMQUV6DM]{Prone}. You remain in your current Fighting Stance until your weapon is dropped, sheathed, or otherwise removed from your possession, you become @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.RK3DF56CKMQUV6DM]{Prone}, @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.PEDR1J13VZXKUF3C]{Stunned}, or @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9KB959MRZ0H4IT4C]{Unconscious}, or until you end your stance as a minor action.
If a stance requires a weapon with a certain trait, all weapons currently wielded must also have that trait, with the exception of shields and natural weapons. Unless the stance says otherwise, shields can be held in an available hand while in a fighting stance. Attacking with a natural weapon that does not meet the requirements of your current Fighting Stance causes you to end your stance before the attack.

Learning New Stances: You learn 2 extra stances at each Growth Level.
Many Fighter Sub-Classes have expanded Fighting Stance options. Once the unlock requirements for Fighting Stances from that Sub-Class have been met, you are able to choose Fighting Stances from that list when learning new stances as part of level up.
